Answer two questions. Candidates must use specific and clearly identified ethnographic illustrations.
Each question is worth [19 marks]. Up to an additional [6 marks] are awarded across both answers.

1.    Discuss conflict in relation to one of the following:

      • globalization
      • gender
      • religion.


2.    To what extent has population movement altered one of the following?

      • kinship
      • labour
      • exchange


3.    Examine how people make use of classification systems to make sense of one of the following:

      • morality
      • the environment
      • space and place.


4.    Examine the relationship between ideology and inequality.


5.    Discuss how either modern media or new technologies have affected social relations.


6.    Discuss the role of either political organization or human rights in indigenous movements.


7.    Examine the importance of economic organization in one of the following:

      • ethnicity
      • age
      • social class.


8.    Examine how modern consumption practices affect society.


9.    Contrast personhood in two societies.


10.   Discuss the role of ritual in either tourism or work.
